org.opends.server.types

Class HostPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.types.HostPort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<HostPort>

    @PublicAPI(stability=UNCOMMITTED,
           mayInstantiate=false,
           mayExtend=false,
           mayInvoke=true)
public final class HostPort
extends Object
implements Comparable<HostPort>
    This class defines a data structure that combines an address and port number, as may be used to accept a connection from or initiate a connection to a remote system.

    Due to the possibility of live network configuration changes, instances of this class are not intended for caching and should be rebuilt on demand.

    Note: this class has a natural ordering that is inconsistent with equals.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String WILDCARD_ADDRESS
      The wildcard address allows to instruct a server to "listen to all addresses".

      • toLowerCaseStrings

        public static Set<String> toLowerCaseStrings(Set<HostPort> hostPorts)
        Converts a set of HostPorts to a new set where each host/port is converted to a lowercase string.
        Parameters:
        hostPorts - the set of host ports to convert
        Returns:
        a new set of strings containing the lowercased string representation of the hostports

      • allAddresses

        public static HostPort allAddresses(int port)
        Returns a a new HostPort for all addresses, also known as a wildcard address.

        Returns:
        a newly constructed HostPort object

      • localAddress

        public static HostPort localAddress(int port)
        Builds a new instance of HostPort representing the local machine with the supplied port.
        Parameters:
        port - the port to use when building the new HostPort object
        Returns:
        a new HostPort instance representing the local machine with the supplied port.

      • valueOf

        public static HostPort valueOf(String hostPort)
                        throws NumberFormatException,
                               IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new HostPort object by parsing the supplied "hostName:port" String URL. This method also accepts IPV6 style "[hostAddress]:port" String URLs.
        Parameters:
        hostPort - a String representing the URL made of a host and a port.
        Returns:
        a new HostPort built from the supplied string.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - If the "port" in the supplied string cannot be converted to an int
        IllegalArgumentException - if no port could be found in the supplied string, or if the port is not a valid port number

      • valueOf

        public static HostPort valueOf(String hostPort,
                               Integer defaultPort)
                        throws NumberFormatException,
                               IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new HostPort object by parsing the supplied "hostName:port" String URL. This method also accepts IPV6 style "[hostAddress]:port" String URLs. Values without ports are allowed if a default port is provided.
        Parameters:
        hostPort - a String representing the URL made of a host and a port.
        defaultPort - if not null then a default port to use if none is present in the string.
        Returns:
        a new HostPort built from the supplied string.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - If the "port" in the supplied string cannot be converted to an int
        IllegalArgumentException - if no port could be found in the supplied string, or if the port is not a valid port number

      • getHost

        public String getHost()
        Retrieves the host for this HostPort object.
        Returns:
        The host for this HostPort object, or null if none was provided.

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Retrieves the port number for this HostPort object.
        Returns:
        The valid port number in the [1, 65535] range for this HostPort object.

        public boolean isLocalAddress()
        Whether the current object represents a local address.

      • isEquivalentTo

        public boolean isEquivalentTo(HostPort other)
        Checks whether the supplied HostPort is an equivalent to the current HostPort.
        Parameters:
        other - the HostPort to compare to "this"
        Returns:
        true if the HostPorts are equivalent, false otherwise. False is also return if calling InetAddress.getAllByName(String) throws an UnknownHostException.
